summary: Completed comprehensive testing of ICF Hub's 4 new features: Auto-scheduling, Email notifications, Analytics dashboard, and Content Calendar. All major functionality is working correctly.

ui_bugs.issue: Company name field validation shows 'Company name is required' error even when field is populated

passed_tests: Backend API Registration and Authentication (100% success rate)
POST /api/schedule - Create scheduled post
GET /api/schedule - Get scheduled posts for authenticated contractor
POST /api/schedule/{id}/publish - Marks post as published and creates notification
DELETE /api/schedule/{id} - Removes scheduled post
POST /api/schedule/bulk - Creates multiple scheduled posts at once
GET /api/notifications - Returns notifications for contractor
GET /api/notifications/unread-count - Returns count of unread notifications
PUT /api/notifications/{id}/read - Marks notification as read
PUT /api/notifications/read-all - Marks all notifications as read
GET /api/analytics - Returns analytics data with leads, content, campaigns, schedule sections
Content Calendar page (/calendar) loads with monthly grid view
Calendar shows navigation (prev/next month, today), platform filter dropdown
Calendar sidebar shows upcoming posts section
Analytics Dashboard page (/analytics) loads with 6 KPI cards and charts
Analytics shows lead pipeline bar chart, leads over time line chart, lead status breakdown
Dashboard notifications tab shows notifications functionality
Navbar shows all new feature navigation links (DASHBOARD, AI CONTENT, CAMPAIGNS, CALENDAR, ANALYTICS)
Content Generator has functional generate button and platform selection
Dashboard has 4 quick-access tool cards (AI Content Generator, AI Campaign Manager, Content Calendar, Analytics Dashboard)
New lead submission triggers notification creation for contractors (verified)
Content generation and scheduling integration workflow working
Notification bell visible in navbar when logged in
action_item_for_main_agent: Fix registration form validation for company name field - validation error appears even when field is populated correctly

success_percentage.frontend: 95% - All major features working, minor registration form validation issue
